Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2012 12:30PM Kemrdx wrote: I've been on Taxol since Oct and have been having a difficult time with my nails (middle fingers especially since they are longer) - what I got were "Tippi" micro gel grips, they are for sorting papers or money I guess but I wear them upside down to cover the tip and nail.  I got them at Office Max and they really seem to help.  I also read that Acetyl L Carnatine (ALCOR) is specifically for neuropathy in the hands and fingernail issues. I have been taking it for a week and am noticing a bit of improvement.  You can get the supplement at Walmart in the vitamin section. Kathy
Posts.Title: Nail Issues Due to Chemo KAM1 lago

Posts.Content: Kemrdx wrote: Hi all,   I've been a lurker for a while (was dx'd with stage 3 triple neg in july 08) but now that I am stage 4, I have many more questions and would like your expert advice:)  I was dx'd in Dec with a small <1cm mediasternal (sp) lesion and cancer cells present in pleural lining.  I was lucky enough to get on the PARP leg of the trial and happy that I am having so few side effects.  They currently pre-medicate with 10mg of Decadron and I hate it, spend 2 days not sleeping and 4 days bloated like he**.  My chemo regimen is Gem/Carbo/PARP on day 1 & 8 and just PARP on days 4 & 11.    What I would like to know is: do you think it's possible to reduce or eliminate the Decadron, and does anyone know if I get to NED on this trial will I have to stay on the chemo indefinitely or will I be able to go into a wait and watch or just do the PARP?  Thanks so much for all your advise!!! Kathy Barry Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/7 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: PARP trials and Decadron Kemrdx chainsawz

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 03:47PM Kemrdx wrote: Julie, I completed WBR at the end of Sept so I will tell you some of the things I found out if it helps. 1. My eyes didn't start swelling until I started Chemo again, it's not from the steroids since I only take 4 mg once a week, didn't think it was about the WBR, but who knows. 2. Horrible dry mouth and my teeth got infected which made me have to go on antibiotics. 3. Appetite is slowly coming back but I lost at least 10lbs in the last 3 months. I had to force myself to eat the first month or so. 4. Ears were plugged for about 2 weeks shortly after, but they are fine now. 5. Still have rubbery legs and lose my balance a bit if I turn too fast. 6. Lost most of my hair and since I am now on Taxol I suppose I have to get used to being bald - least of my problems lol. 7. 6 week follow-up MRI was clear as bell and my tumor markers are coming down:)
Posts.Title: Side effects of WBR julie26 china

Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 08:03AM Kemrdx wrote: Another TN w/mets here - I got about 10 months breathing room then I couldn't breath.  Found out I had metatstic pleural efflusion and hot nodes in the mediastinal.  I was lucky to qualify for the Parp trial and have been stable with some shrikage (2.5 cm to less than 1 cm on the mediastinal node).  Athough I have to go in for monthly thorocentisis the side effects have been really managable.  Wishing you the best of luck and hopefully many more years with you little ones.
Posts.Title: Did not know where to go..... angelsabove vickib

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 05:02AM Kemrdx wrote: imbell, I just completed WBR on the 16th of Sept this year.  I had minor fatigue, almost total hair loss and my one ear was clogged for about a week.  One SE they didn't tell me about, that is supposedly very common, is an extremely dry mouth which caused my teeth to get infected. I'm on antibiotics for it right now and my teeth are getting better. My understanding is that they can give you shots to prevent it so I would ask about it. Other than still getting minor headaches (Tylenol) and a little dizzy if I turn too fast I seem to be doing ok, just wish my cooked salivary glands would start working again LOL.
Posts.Title: NEED WBR TIPS imbell imbell

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2010 05:34PM - edited Jun 30, 2010 05:34PM by Kemrdx I don't have bone mets but am on Zometa monthly as a preventative.  Just like Renee stated, studies have shown "see the breaking news" that it may lower recurrence risks and as a TN I need anything I can't get to keep this beast at bay:)  Kathy
Posts.Title: Is stopping Zometa a safe thing to do? Joyce4123 lisa34lisa

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2012 11:27AM Kemrdx wrote: Canchaser, I was on on a clinical trial with Gemzar, Carbo and BSI-102. I was diagnosed Dec 10th 2009, NED by April 2010.  They had to lower and finally complety remove Gemzar from the protocol because of platelet and red count issues.  Other than the blood count issues, I had zero SE's, I did ask that they lower my steroid dose from 10mg to 2mg since I wasn't getting sick and I wanted to be able to sleep at night and my hair thinned with Gemzar but grew back like a weed on carbo alone. I was taken off the ckinical trial in Sept 2011 when I ended up with Cancer seeded it in my brain.  Had WBR and am on taxol and avastin so ha-ha my nails look like crap and I am bald again, oh well, onc just said today hes is going to give me a taxol break after the next session if the pet comes back as good as he thinks It will.  So basically,I got 19 months out of this combo and felt pretty much normal most of the time.  Gemzar might make your hair thin and if you are having difficulties with SE's ask that your onc lower your dose - it's you body and you are going to die from this damn disease anyway so why be miserable at the same time.  Sending you hugs  --  Kathy
